items.article_title: When Eco-Friendly Became Illegal
items.text:
We're standing in the warehouse looking at 40,000 units we can't ship.

Now each one is worth 4% of annual turnover in fines.

The boxes are fine.

items.article_title: The Ponds That Went Dry
items.text:
He lost half his crop.

Now, in February, during a drought in its seventh month, he's installing two more center pivot systems at $60,000 each.

Plus $300 a day in diesel when they run.

https://www.anchor.is/docket/issue/18/lived/article/9381

items.article_title: Following the Salt Inland
items.text:
This wetland didn't exist when she was young—just a forest depression before salt moved inland, before the trees died and brackish water pooled.

The terrapins followed the salt inland.

https://www.anchor.is/docket/issue/18/futures/article/9340
#ClimateCrisis #Longform

items.article_title: Baghdad Ran 65,000 Baths Simultaneously
items.text:
Medieval Baghdad didn't pick one water technology.

The city combined underground qanāts, cisterns, gravity-fed aqueducts, and rainwater collection to support 65,000 public baths.

The systems worked for centuries…

https://www.anchor.is/docket/issue/18/archive/article/9371
#news #ClimateCrisis

items.article_title: No Federal Standard for Sea Rise
items.text:
Your coastal town developed its own elevation guidance.

items.article_title: Kashmir Dammed a Lake in 880 CE
items.text:
The intervention worked—catastrophic floods stopped.

We don't have good records on maintenance costs or how long the system lasted, but ninth-century hydraulic engineering was more sophisticated than we usually assume.

items.article_title: Waiting on Spring Snowpack Numbers
items.text:

Mid-January satellite imagery showed the lowest western snow cover in twenty-five years.
